metadata.title: CVE-2021-47074 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nvme-loop: fix memory leak in nvme_loop_create_ctrl() When creating loopctrl in nvme_loop_create_ctrl(), if nvme_init_ctrl() fails, the loop ctrlshould be freed before jumping to the "out" label.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
